FTD (frontotemporal degeneration)

* Often affects people under 60,
* There is sometimes a family history of FTD.
* Genetic and lesional heterogeneity (abnormal metabolism of tau protein).

The initial clinical presentation is often marked by :

* BEHAVIOURAL DISORDERS'' by behavioural executive impairment (disinhibition, apathy, impulsivity, eating disorders...)
* Dysexecutive syndrome
* Neurological examination initially normal, then appearance of archaic reflexes, pyramidal syndrome, astasia-abasia, etc.
* Bilateral anterior ''FRONTAL and TEMPORAL ATROPHIA'' on brain MRI

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT typically associated with the initial clinical presentation of frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTD)?
properties.option_b: Normal neurological examination followed by archaic reflexes
properties.option_c: Bilateral frontal and temporal atrophy on MRI
properties.option_d: Memory loss and difficulty in language comprehension
